   22: %% 
   23: %% ct:run("../inets_test", httpc_SUITE).
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(httpc_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   29: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -include("inets_test_lib.hrl").
   32: -include("http_internal.hrl").
   33: -include("httpc_internal.hrl").
   34: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   35: -compile(export_all).
   36: 
   37: -define(URL_START, "http://").
   38: -define(TLS_URL_START, "https://").
   39: -define(NOT_IN_USE_PORT, 8997).
   40: 
   41: %% Using hardcoded file path to keep it below 107 characters
   42: %% (maximum length supported by erlang)
   43: -define(UNIX_SOCKET, "/tmp/inets_httpc_SUITE.sock").
   44: 
   45: -record(sslsocket, {fd = nil, pid = nil}).
   46: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   47: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   48: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap,{seconds, 30}}
   52:     ].
   53: 
   54: all() ->
   55:     [
   56:      {group, http},
   57:      {group, http_ipv6},
   58:      {group, sim_http},
   59:      {group, http_internal},
   60:      {group, http_unix_socket},
   61:      {group, https},
   62:      {group, sim_https},
   63:      {group, misc},
   64:      {group, sim_mixed} % HTTP and HTTPS sim servers
   65:     ].
   66: 
   67: groups() ->
   68:     [
   69:      {http, [], real_requests()},
   70:      {http_ipv6, [], [request_options]},
   71:      %% process_leak_on_keepalive is depending on stream_fun_server_close
   72:      %% and it shall be the last test case in the suite otherwise cookie
   73:      %% will fail.
   74:      {sim_http, [], only_simulated() ++ server_closing_connection() ++ [process_leak_on_keepalive]},
   75:      {http_internal, [], real_requests_esi()},
   76:      {http_unix_socket, [], simulated_unix_socket()},
   77:      {https, [], [def_ssl_opt | real_requests()]},
   78:      {sim_https, [], only_simulated()},
   79:      {misc, [], misc()},
   80:      {sim_mixed, [], sim_mixed()}
   81:     ].
   82: 
   83: real_requests()->
   84:     [
   85:      head,
   86:      get,
   87:      get_query_string,
   88:      post,
   89:      delete,
   90:      post_stream,
   91:      patch,
   92:      async,
   93:      pipeline,
   94:      persistent_connection,
   95:      save_to_file,
   96:      save_to_file_async,
   97:      headers_as_is,
   98:      page_does_not_exist,
   99:      emulate_lower_versions,
  100:      headers,
  101:      headers_as_is,
  102:      header_type_0,
  103:      header_type_1,
  104:      header_type_2,
  105:      header_type_3,
  106:      header_type_4,
  107:      header_type_5,
  108:      header_type_6,
  109:      header_type_7,
  110:      header_type_8,
  111:      header_type_9,
  112:      header_type_10,
  113:      header_type_11,
  114:      header_type_12,
  115:      header_type_13,
  116:      header_type_14,
  117:      header_type_15,
  118:      header_type_16,
  119:      header_type_17,
  120:      header_type_18,
  121:      header_type_19,
  122:      header_type_20,
  123:      header_type_21,
  124:      header_type_22,
  125:      header_type_23,
  126:      empty_body,
  127:      stream,
  128:      stream_to_pid,
  129:      stream_through_fun,
  130:      stream_through_mfa,
  131:      streaming_error,
  132:      inet_opts,
  133:      invalid_headers_key,
  134:      invalid_headers_value,
  135:      invalid_body,
  136:      invalid_body_fun,
  137:      invalid_method,
  138:      no_scheme,
  139:      invalid_uri,
  140:      binary_url,
  141:      iolist_body
  142:     ].
  143: 
  144: real_requests_esi() ->
  145:     [slow_connection].
  146: 
  147: simulated_unix_socket() ->
  148:     [unix_domain_socket].
  149: 
  150: only_simulated() ->
  151:     [
  152:      cookie,
  153:      cookie_profile,
  154:      empty_set_cookie,
  155:      invalid_set_cookie,
  156:      trace,
  157:      stream_once,
  158:      stream_single_chunk,
  159:      stream_no_length,
  160:      not_streamed_once,
  161:      stream_large_not_200_or_206,
  162:      no_content_204,
  163:      tolerate_missing_CR,
  164:      userinfo,
  165:      bad_response,
  166:      timeout_redirect,
  167:      internal_server_error,
  168:      invalid_http,
  169:      invalid_chunk_size,
  170:      headers_dummy,
  171:      headers_with_obs_fold,
  172:      headers_conflict_chunked_with_length,
  173:      empty_response_header,
  174:      remote_socket_close,
  175:      remote_socket_close_async,
  176:      transfer_encoding,
  177:      transfer_encoding_identity,
  178:      redirect_loop,
  179:      redirect_moved_permanently,
  180:      redirect_multiple_choises,
  181:      redirect_found,
  182:      redirect_see_other,
  183:      redirect_temporary_redirect,
  184:      redirect_permanent_redirect,
  185:      redirect_relative_uri,
  186:      port_in_host_header,
  187:      redirect_port_in_host_header,
  188:      relaxed,
  189:      multipart_chunks,
  190:      get_space,
  191:      delete_no_body,
  192:      post_with_content_type,
  193:      stream_fun_server_close
  194:     ].
  195: 
  196: server_closing_connection() ->
  197:     [
  198:      server_closing_connection_on_first_response,
  199:      server_closing_connection_on_second_response
  200:     ].
  201: 
  202: misc() ->
  203:     [
  204:      server_does_not_exist,
  205:      timeout_memory_leak,
  206:      wait_for_whole_response,
  207:      post_204_chunked,
  208:      head_chunked_empty_body,
  209:      head_empty_body,
  210:      chunkify_fun
  211:     ].
  212: 
  213: sim_mixed() ->
  214:     [
  215:      redirect_http_to_https,
  216:      redirect_relative_different_port
  217:     ].
  218: 
  219: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  220: 
  221: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  222:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  223:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  224:     inets_test_lib:start_apps([inets]),
  225:     ServerRoot = filename:join(PrivDir, "server_root"),
  226:     DocRoot = filename:join(ServerRoot, "htdocs"),
  227:     setup_server_dirs(ServerRoot, DocRoot, DataDir),
  228:     [{server_root, ServerRoot}, {doc_root, DocRoot}  | Config].
  229: 
  230: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  231:     inets_test_lib:stop_apps([inets]),
  232:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  233:     inets_test_lib:del_dirs(PrivDir),
  234:     ok.
  235: 
  236: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: init_per_group(misc = Group, Config) ->
  238:     start_apps(Group),
  239:     Inet = inet_version(),
  240:     ok = httpc:set_options([{ipfamily, Inet}]),
  241:     Config;
  242: 
  243: 
  244: init_per_group(Group, Config0) when Group =:= sim_https; Group =:= https;
  245:                                     Group =:= sim_mixed ->
  246:     catch crypto:stop(),
  247:     try crypto:start() of
  248:         ok ->
  249:             start_apps(Group),
  250:             do_init_per_group(Group, Config0)
  251:     catch
  252:         _:_ ->
  253:             {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  254:     end;
  255: init_per_group(http_unix_socket = Group, Config0) ->
  256:     case os:type() of
  257:         {win32,_} ->
  258:             {skip, "Unix Domain Sockets are not supported on Windows"};
  259:         _ ->
  260:             file:delete(?UNIX_SOCKET),
  261:             start_apps(Group),
  262:             Config = proplists:delete(port, Config0),
  263:             {Pid, Port} = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  264:             lists:append([{dummy_server_pid, Pid}, {port, Port}], Config)
  265:     end;
  266: init_per_group(http_ipv6 = Group, Config0) ->
  267:     case is_ipv6_supported() of
  268:         true ->
  269:             start_apps(Group),
  270:             Config = proplists:delete(port, Config0),
  271:             Port = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  272:             [{port, Port} | Config];
  273:         false ->
  274:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  275:      end;
  276: init_per_group(Group, Config0) ->
  277:     start_apps(Group),
  278:     Config = proplists:delete(port, Config0),
  279:     Port = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  280:     [{port, Port} | Config].
  281: 
  282: end_per_group(http_unix_socket, Config) ->
  283:     Pid = ?config(dummy_server_pid, Config),
  284:     Pid ! {stop, self()},
  285:     %% request is needed for enforcing dummy server and handlers stop; without a
  286:     %% it, dummy server waits in gen_tcp:accept and will not process stop request
  287:     httpc:request(get, {"http://localhost/v1/kv/foo", []}, [], []),
  288:     receive
  289:         {stopped, DummyServerPid} ->
  290:             ok
  291:     end,
  292:     file:delete(?UNIX_SOCKET),
  293:     ok;
  294: end_per_group(_, _Config) ->
  295:     ok.
  296: 
  297: do_init_per_group(Group=sim_mixed, Config0) ->
  298:     % The mixed group uses two server ports (http and https), so we use
  299:     % different config names here.
  300:     Config1 = init_ssl(Config0),
  301:     Config2 = proplists:delete(http_port, proplists:delete(https_port, Config1)),
  302:     {HttpPort, HttpsPort} = server_start(Group, server_config(sim_https, Config2)),
  303:     [{http_port, HttpPort} | [{https_port, HttpsPort} | Config2]];
  304: do_init_per_group(Group, Config0) ->
  305:     Config1 =
  306:         case Group of
  307:             https ->
  308:                 init_ssl(Config0);
  309:             sim_https ->
  310:                 init_ssl(Config0);
  311:             _ ->
  312:                 Config0
  313:         end,
  314:     Config = proplists:delete(port, Config1),
  315:     Port = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  316:     [{port, Port} | Config].
  317: 
  318: init_ssl(Config) ->
  319:     ClientFileBase = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "client"]),
  320:     ServerFileBase = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "server"]),
  321:     GenCertData =
  322:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain => 
  323:                                         #{root => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)}],
  324:                                           intermediates => [[{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)}]],
  325:                                           peer => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)}
  326:                                                   ]},
  327:                                     client_chain => 
  328:                                         #{root => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)}],
  329:                                           intermediates => [[{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)}]],
  330:                                           peer => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)}]}}),
  331: 
  332:     Conf = inets_test_lib:gen_pem_config_files(GenCertData, ClientFileBase, ServerFileBase),
  333:     [{ssl_conf, Conf} | Config].
  334: 
  335: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  336: init_per_testcase(pipeline, Config) ->
  337:     inets:start(httpc, [{profile, pipeline}]),
  338:     httpc:set_options([{pipeline_timeout, 50000},
  339:                        {max_pipeline_length, 3}], pipeline),
  340: 
  341:     Config;
  342: init_per_testcase(persistent_connection, Config) ->
  343:     inets:start(httpc, [{profile, persistent}]),
  344:     httpc:set_options([{keep_alive_timeout, 50000},
  345: 		       {max_keep_alive_length, 3}], persistent),
  346: 
  347:     Config;
  348: init_per_testcase(wait_for_whole_response, Config) ->
  349:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 60*3}),
  350:     Config;
  351: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case == post;
  352: 				     Case == delete;
  353: 				     Case == post_delete;
  354: 				     Case == post_stream ->
  355:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 30}),
  356:     Config;
  357: init_per_testcase(async, Config) ->
  358:     {ok,Pid} = inets:start(httpc, [{profile, async}], stand_alone),
  359:     [{httpc_pid, Pid} | Config];
  360: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  361:     Config.
  362: 
  363: end_per_testcase(pipeline, _Config) ->
  364:     inets:stop(httpc, pipeline);
  365: end_per_testcase(persistent_connection, _Config) ->
  366:     inets:stop(httpc, persistent);
  367: end_per_testcase(async, Config) ->
  368:     Pid = proplists:get_value(httpc_pid, Config),
  369:     inets:stop(httpc, Pid);
  370: end_per_testcase(Case, Config)
  371:   when Case == server_closing_connection_on_first_response;
  372:        Case == server_closing_connection_on_second_response ->
  373:     %% Test case uses at most one session.  Ensure no leftover
  374:     %% sessions left behind.
  375:     {_, Status} = proplists:lookup(tc_status, Config),
  376:     ShallCleanup = case Status of
  377:                        ok -> true;
  378:                        {failed, _} -> true;
  379:                        {skipped, _} -> false
  380:                    end,
  381:     if ShallCleanup =:= true ->
  382:             httpc:request(url(group_name(Config), "/just_close.html", Config)),
  383:             ok;
  384:        true ->
  385:             ct:pal("Not cleaning up because test case status was ~p", [Status]),
  386:             ok
  387:     end;
  388: 
  389: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
  390:     ok.
  391: 
  392: 
  393: 
  394: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  395: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  396: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  397: 
  398: head() ->
  399:     [{doc, "Test http head request against local server."}].
  400: 
  401: head(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  403:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}} = httpc:request(head, Request, [], []).
  404: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  405: get() ->
  406:     [{doc, "Test http get request against local server"}].
  407: get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  408:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  409:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], []),
  410: 
  411:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body),
  412: 
  413:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], BinBody}} =  httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{body_format, binary}]),
  414:     true = is_binary(BinBody).
  415: 
  416: 
  417: get_query_string() ->
  418:     [{doc, "Test http get request with query string against local server"}].
  419: get_query_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  420:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html?foo=bar", Config), []},
  421:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], []),
  422: 
  423:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body).
  424: 
  425: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  426: get_space() ->
  427:     [{"Test http get request with '%20' in the path of the URL."}].
  428: get_space(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/space%20.html", Config), []},
  430:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], []),
  431: 
  432:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body).
  433: 
  434: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  435: post() ->
  436:     [{"Test http post request against local server. We do in this case "
  437:      "only care about the client side of the the post. The server "
  438:      "script will not actually use the post data."}].
  439: post(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  440:     CGI = case os:type() of
  441: 	      {win32, _} ->
  442: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  443: 	      _ ->
  444: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  445: 	  end,
  446: 
  447:      URL = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  448: 
  449:     %% Cgi-script expects the body length to be 100
  450:     Body = lists:duplicate(100, "1"),
  451: 
  452:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  453: 	httpc:request(post, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  454: 			     "text/plain", Body}, [], []),
  455: 
  456:     {ok, {{_,504,_}, [_ | _], []}} =
  457: 	httpc:request(post, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  458: 			     "text/plain", "foobar"}, [], []).
  459: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  460: delete() ->
  461:     [{"Test http delete request against local server. We do in this case "
  462:      "only care about the client side of the the delete. The server "
  463:      "script will not actually use the delete data."}].
  464: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  465:     CGI = case os:type() of
  466:           {win32, _} ->
  467:           "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  468:           _ ->
  469:           "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  470:       end,
  471: 
  472:     URL  = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  473:     Body = lists:duplicate(100, "1"),
  474: 
  475:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  476:     httpc:request(delete, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  477:                  "text/plain", Body}, [], []),
  478: 
  479:     {ok, {{_,504,_}, [_ | _], []}} =
  480:     httpc:request(delete, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  481:                  "text/plain", "foobar"}, [], []).
  482: 
  483: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  484: patch() ->
  485:     [{"Test http patch request against local server. We do in this case "
  486:      "only care about the client side of the the patch. The server "
  487:      "script will not actually use the patch data."}].
  488: patch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  489:     CGI = case os:type() of
  490: 	      {win32, _} ->
  491: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  492: 	      _ ->
  493: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  494: 	  end,
  495: 
  496:      URL = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  497: 
  498:     %% Cgi-script expects the body length to be 100
  499:     Body = lists:duplicate(100, "1"),
  500: 
  501:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  502: 	httpc:request(patch, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  503: 			     "text/plain", Body}, [], []).
  504: 
  505: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  506: post_stream() ->
  507:     [{"Test streaming http post request against local server. "
  508:      "We only care about the client side of the the post. "
  509:      "The server script will not actually use the post data."}].
  510: post_stream(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     CGI = case os:type() of
  512: 	      {win32, _} ->
  513: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  514: 	      _ ->
  515: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  516: 	  end,
  517: 
  518:      URL = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  519: 
  520:     %% Cgi-script expects the body length to be 100
  521:     BodyFun = fun(0) ->
  522: 		      eof;
  523: 		 (LenLeft) ->
  524: 		      {ok, lists:duplicate(10, "1"), LenLeft - 10}
  525: 	      end,
  526: 
  527:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  528: 	httpc:request(post, {URL,
  529: 			     [{"expect", "100-continue"},
  530: 			      {"content-length", "100"}],
  531: 			     "text/plain", {BodyFun, 100}}, [], []),
  532: 
  533:     {ok, {{_,504,_}, [_ | _], []}} =
  534: 	httpc:request(post, {URL,
  535: 			     [{"expect", "100-continue"},
  536: 			      {"content-length", "10"}],
  537: 			     "text/plain", {BodyFun, 10}}, [], []).
  538: 
  539: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  540: trace() ->
  541:     [{doc, "Perform a TRACE request."}].
  542: trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/trace.html", Config), []},
  544:     case httpc:request(trace, Request, [], []) of
  545: 	{ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], "TRACE /trace.html" ++ _}} ->
  546: 	    ok;
  547: 	 Other ->
  548: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  549:     end.  
  550: 
  551: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  552: 
  553: pipeline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  554:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  555:     {ok, _} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], [], pipeline),
  556: 
  557:     %% Make sure pipeline session is registered
  558:     ct:sleep(4000),
  559:     keep_alive_requests(Request, pipeline).
  560: 
  561: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  562: 
  563: persistent_connection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  564:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  565:     {ok, _} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], [], persistent),
  566: 
  567:     %% Make sure pipeline session is registered
  568:     ct:sleep(4000),
  569:     keep_alive_requests(Request, persistent).
  570: 
  571: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  572: async() ->
  573:     [{doc, "Test an asynchrony http request."}].
  574: async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  575:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  576:     HttpcPid = proplists:get_value(httpc_pid, Config),
  577: 
  578:     {ok, RequestId} =
  579:         httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{sync, false}]),
  580:     Body =
  581:         receive
  582:             {http, {RequestId, {{_, 200, _}, _, BinBody}}} ->
  583:                 BinBody;
  584:             {http, Msg} ->
  585:                 ct:fail(Msg)
  586:         end,
  587:     inets_test_lib:check_body(binary_to_list(Body)),
  588: 
  589:     %% Check full result false option for async request
  590:     {ok, RequestId2} =
  591:         httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{sync, false},
  592:                                          {full_result, false}]),
  593:     Body2 =
  594:         receive
  595:             {http, {RequestId2, 200, BinBody2}} ->
  596:                 BinBody2;
  597:             {http, Msg2} ->
  598:                 ct:fail(Msg2)
  599:         end,
  600:     inets_test_lib:check_body(binary_to_list(Body2)),
  601: 
  602:     %% Check receiver alias() option for async request with stand_alone httpc
  603:     {ok, RequestId3} =
  604:         httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{sync, false},
  605:                                          {receiver, alias()}], HttpcPid),
  606:     Body3 =
  607:         receive
  608:             {http, {RequestId3, {{_, 200, _}, _, BinBody3}}} ->
  609:                 BinBody3;
  610:             {http, Msg3} ->
  611:                 ct:fail(Msg3)
  612:         end,
  613:     inets_test_lib:check_body(binary_to_list(Body3)),
  614:     {ok, NewRequestId} =
  615: 	httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{sync, false}]),
  616:     ok = httpc:cancel_request(NewRequestId).
  617: 
  618: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  619: save_to_file() ->
  620:     [{doc, "Test to save the http body to a file"}].
  621: save_to_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  622:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  623:     FilePath = filename:join(PrivDir, "dummy.html"),
  624:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
  625:     Request = {URL, []},
  626:     {ok, saved_to_file}
  627: 	= httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{stream, FilePath}]),
  628:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(FilePath),
  629:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body}} = httpc:request(URL),
  630:     Bin == Body.
  631: 
  632: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  633: save_to_file_async() ->
  634:     [{doc,"Test to save the http body to a file"}].
  635: save_to_file_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  636:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  637:     FilePath = filename:join(PrivDir, "dummy.html"),
  638:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
  639:     Request = {URL, []},
  640:     {ok, RequestId} = httpc:request(get, Request, [],
  641: 				    [{stream, FilePath},
  642: 				     {sync, false}]),
  643:     receive
  644: 	{http, {RequestId, saved_to_file}} ->
  645: 	    ok;
  646: 	{http, Msg} ->
  647: 	    ct:fail(Msg)
  648:     end,
  649: 
  650:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(FilePath),
  651:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body}} = httpc:request(URL),
  652:     Bin == Body.
  653: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  654: stream() ->
  655:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for asynchrony requests"}].
  656: stream(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  657:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  658:     stream_test(Request, {stream, self}).
  659: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  660: stream_once() ->
  661:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for asynchrony requests"}].
  662: stream_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     Request0  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  664:     stream_test(Request0, {stream, {self, once}}),
  665: 
  666:     Request1  = {url(group_name(Config), "/once.html", Config), []},
  667:     stream_test(Request1, {stream, {self, once}}),
  668: 
  669:     Request2  = {url(group_name(Config), "/once_chunked.html", Config), []},
  670:     stream_test(Request2, {stream, {self, once}}).
  671: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  672: stream_single_chunk() ->
  673:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for asynchrony requests"}].
  674: stream_single_chunk(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  675:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/single_chunk.html", Config), []},
  676:     stream_test(Request, {stream, self}).
  677: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  678: stream_no_length() ->
  679:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for asynchrony requests with HTTP 1.0 "
  680:       "body end on closed connection" }].
  681: stream_no_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  682:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/http_1_0_no_length_single.html", Config), []},
  683:     stream_test(Request1, {stream, self}),
  684:     Request2 = {url(group_name(Config), "/http_1_0_no_length_multiple.html", Config), []},
  685:     stream_test(Request2, {stream, self}).
  686: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  687: stream_large_not_200_or_206() ->
  688:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for large responses with status codes "
  689:       "other than 200 or 206" }].
  690: stream_large_not_200_or_206(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  691:     Request = {url(group_name(Config), "/large_404_response.html", Config), []},
  692:     {404, _} = not_streamed_test(Request, {stream, self}).
  693: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  694: not_streamed_once() ->
  695:     [{doc, "Test not streamed responses with once streaming"}].
  696: not_streamed_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  697:     Request0 = {url(group_name(Config), "/404.html", Config), []},
  698:     {404, _} = not_streamed_test(Request0, {stream, {self, once}}),
  699:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/404_chunked.html", Config), []},
  700:     {404, _} = not_streamed_test(Request1, {stream, {self, once}}).
  701:

  703: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  704: redirect_multiple_choises() ->
  705:     [{doc, "The user agent, selection of the most appropriate choice MAY "
  706:       "be performed automatically."}].
  707: redirect_multiple_choises(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  708:     URL300 = url(group_name(Config), "/300.html", Config),
  709: 
  710:     catch {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  711: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL300, []}, [], []),
  712: 
  713:     {ok, {{_,300,_}, [_ | _], _}} =
  714: 	httpc:request(get, {URL300, []}, [{autoredirect, false}], []).
  715: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  716: redirect_moved_permanently() ->
  717:     [{doc, "The server SHOULD generate a Location header field in the response "
  718:       "containing a preferred URI reference for the new permanent URI.  The user "
  719:       "agent MAY use the Location field value for automatic redirection.  The server's " 
  720:       "response payload usually contains a short hypertext note with a "
  721:       "hyperlink to the new URI(s)."}].
  722: redirect_moved_permanently(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  723: 
  724:     URL301 = url(group_name(Config), "/301.html", Config),
  725: 
  726:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  727: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL301, []}, [], []),
  728: 
  729:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}}
  730: 	= httpc:request(head, {URL301, []}, [], []),
  731: 
  732:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  733: 	= httpc:request(post, {URL301, [],"text/plain", "foobar"},
  734: 			[], []).

  843: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  844: redirect_http_to_https() ->
  845:     [{doc, "Test that a 30X redirect from one scheme to another is handled "
  846:       "correctly."}].
  847: redirect_http_to_https(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  848:     URL301 = mixed_url(http, "/301_custom_url.html", Config),
  849:     TargetUrl = mixed_url(https, "/dummy.html", Config),
  850:     Headers = [{"x-test-301-url", TargetUrl}],
  851: 
  852:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  853: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL301, Headers}, [], []),
  854: 
  855:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}}
  856: 	= httpc:request(head, {URL301, Headers}, [], []),
  857: 
  858:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  859: 	= httpc:request(post, {URL301, Headers, "text/plain", "foobar"},
  860: 			[], []).
  861: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  862: redirect_relative_different_port() ->
  863:     [{doc, "Test that a 30X redirect with a relative target, but different "
  864:       "port, is handled correctly."}].
  865: redirect_relative_different_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  866:     URL301 = mixed_url(http, "/301_custom_url.html", Config),
  867: 
  868:     % We need an extra server of the same protocol here, so spawn a new
  869:     % HTTP-protocol one
  870:     Port = server_start(sim_http, []),
  871:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  872:     % Prefix the URI with '/' instead of a scheme
  873:     TargetUrl = "//" ++ Host ++ ":" ++ integer_to_list(Port) ++ "/dummy.html",
  874:     Headers = [{"x-test-301-url", TargetUrl}],
  875: 
  876:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  877: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL301, Headers}, [], []),
  878: 
  879:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}}
  880: 	= httpc:request(head, {URL301, Headers}, [], []),
  881: 
  882:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  883: 	= httpc:request(post, {URL301, Headers, "text/plain", "foobar"},
  884: 			[], []).
  885: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  886: cookie() ->
  887:     [{doc, "Test cookies."}].
  888: cookie(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  889:     ok = httpc:set_options([{cookies, enabled}]),
  890: 
  891:     Request0 = {url(group_name(Config), "/cookie.html", Config), []},
  892: 
  893:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  894: 	= httpc:request(get, Request0, [], []),
  895: 
  896:     %% Populate table to be used by the "dummy" server
  897:     ets:new(cookie, [named_table, public, set]),
  898:     ets:insert(cookie, {cookies, true}),
  899: 
  900:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/", Config), []},
  901: 
  902:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  903: 	= httpc:request(get, Request1, [], []),
  904: 
  905:    [{session_cookies, [_|_]}] = httpc:which_cookies(httpc:default_profile()),
  906: 
  907:     ets:delete(cookie),
  908:     ok = httpc:set_options([{cookies, disabled}]).
  909: 
  910: 
  911: 
  912: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  913: cookie_profile() ->
  914:     [{doc, "Test cookies on a non default profile."}].
  915: cookie_profile(Config) when is_list(Config) ->   
  916:     inets:start(httpc, [{profile, cookie_test}]),
  917:     ok = httpc:set_options([{cookies, enabled}], cookie_test),
  918: 
  919:     Request0 = {url(group_name(Config), "/cookie.html", Config), []},
  920: 
  921:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  922: 	= httpc:request(get, Request0, [], [], cookie_test),
  923: 
  924:     %% Populate table to be used by the "dummy" server
  925:     ets:new(cookie, [named_table, public, set]),
  926:     ets:insert(cookie, {cookies, true}),
  927: 
  928:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/", Config), []},
  929: 
  930:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  931: 	= httpc:request(get, Request1, [], [], cookie_test),
  932: 
  933:     ets:delete(cookie),
  934:     inets:stop(httpc, cookie_test).
  935:

 1000: streaming_error(doc) ->
 1001:     [{doc, "Only async requests can be stremed - Solves OTP-8056"}];
 1002: 
 1003: streaming_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1004:     Method      = get,
 1005:     Request     = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
 1006:     {error, streaming_error} = httpc:request(Method, Request,
 1007: 					     [],  [{sync, true}, {stream, {self, once}}]),
 1008:     {error, streaming_error} = httpc:request(Method, Request,
 1009: 					     [], [{sync, true}, {stream, self}]).

 1061: 
 1062: empty_response_header() ->
 1063:     [{doc, "Test the case that the HTTP server does not send any headers. Solves OTP-6830"}].
 1064: empty_response_header(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1065:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/no_headers.html", Config),
 1066:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [], [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(URL).
 1067: 
 1068: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1069: 
 1070: bad_response(doc) ->
 1071:     [{doc, "Test what happens when the server does not follow the protocol"}];
 1072: 
 1073: bad_response(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1074: 
 1075:     URL0 = url(group_name(Config), "/missing_crlf.html", Config),
 1076:     URL1 = url(group_name(Config), "/wrong_statusline.html", Config),
 1077: 
 1078:     {error, timeout} = httpc:request(get, {URL0, []}, [{timeout, 400}], []),
 1079:     {error, Reason} = httpc:request(URL1),
 1080: 
 1081:     ct:print("Wrong Statusline: ~p~n", [Reason]).
 1082: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1083: 
 1084: timeout_redirect() ->
 1085:     [{doc, "Test that timeout works for redirects, check ERL-420."}].
 1086: timeout_redirect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1087:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/redirect_to_missing_crlf.html", Config),
 1088:     {error, timeout} = httpc:request(get, {URL, []}, [{timeout, 400}], []).
 1089: 
 1090: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1091: 
 1092: internal_server_error(doc) ->
 1093:     ["Test 50X codes"];
 1094: internal_server_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1095: 
 1096:     URL500 = url(group_name(Config), "/500.html", Config),
 1097: 
 1098:     {ok, {{_,500,_}, [_ | _], _}}
 1099: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL500, []}, [], []),
 1100: 
 1101:     URL503 = url(group_name(Config), "/503.html", Config),
 1102: 
 1103:     %% Used to be able to make the service available after retry.
 1104:     ets:new(unavailable, [named_table, public, set]),
 1105:     ets:insert(unavailable, {503, unavailable}),
 1106: 
 1107:     {ok, {{_,200, _}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} =
 1108: 	httpc:request(get, {URL503, []}, [], []),
 1109: 
 1110:     ets:insert(unavailable, {503, long_unavailable}),
 1111: 
 1112:     {ok, {{_,503, _}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} =
 1113: 	httpc:request(get, {URL503, []}, [], []),
 1114: 
 1115:     ets:delete(unavailable).
 1116:

 1152:

 1154:

 1156: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, []}, [{version, "HTTP/1.0"}], []),
 1157:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body1),
 1158:     {ok, {{"HTTP/1.1", 200, _}, [_ | _], Body2 = [_ | _]}} =
 1159: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, []}, [{version, "HTTP/1.1"}], []),
 1160:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body2).

 1164: relaxed(doc) ->
 1165:     ["Test relaxed mode"];
 1166: relaxed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1167: 
 1168:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/missing_reason_phrase.html", Config),
 1169: 
 1170:     {error, Reason} =
 1171: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, []}, [{relaxed, false}], []),
 1172: 
 1173:     ct:print("Not relaxed: ~p~n", [Reason]),
 1174: 
 1175:     {ok, {{_, 200, _}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1176: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, []}, [{relaxed, true}], []).

 1179: 
 1180: headers() ->
 1181:     [{doc,"Use as many request headers as possible not used in proxy_headers"}].
 1182: headers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1183: 
 1184:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1185:     DocRoot = proplists:get_value(doc_root, Config),
 1186: 
 1187:     {ok, FileInfo} =
 1188: 	file:read_file_info(filename:join([DocRoot,"dummy.html"])),
 1189:     CreatedSec =
 1190: 	calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(
 1191: 	  FileInfo#file_info.mtime),
 1192: 
 1193:     Mod = httpd_util:rfc1123_date(
 1194: 	    calendar:gregorian_seconds_to_datetime(
 1195: 	      CreatedSec-1)),
 1196: 
 1197:     Date = httpd_util:rfc1123_date({date(), time()}),
 1198: 
 1199:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1200: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-Modified-Since",
 1201: 				   Mod},
 1202: 				  {"From","webmaster@erlang.se"},
 1203: 				  {"Date", Date}
 1204: 				 ]}, [], []),
 1205: 
 1206:     Mod1 =  httpd_util:rfc1123_date(
 1207: 	      calendar:gregorian_seconds_to_datetime(
 1208: 		CreatedSec+1)),
 1209: 
 1210:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1211: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-UnModified-Since",
 1212: 				   Mod1}
 1213: 				 ]}, [], []),
 1214: 
 1215:     Tag = httpd_util:create_etag(FileInfo),
 1216: 
 1217: 
 1218:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1219: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-Match",
 1220: 				   Tag}
 1221: 				 ]}, [], []),
 1222: 
 1223:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], _}} =
 1224: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-None-Match",
 1225: 				   "NotEtag,NeihterEtag"},
 1226: 				  {"Connection", "Close"}
 1227: 				 ]}, [], []).
 1228: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1229: headers_dummy() ->
 1230:     ["Test the code for handling headers we do not want/can send "
 1231:      "to a real server. Note it is not logical to send"
 1232:      "all of these headers together, we only want to test that"
 1233:      "the code for handling headers will not crash."].
 1234: 
 1235: headers_dummy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1236: 
 1237:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy_headers.html", Config),
 1238: 
 1239:     Foo = http_chunk:encode("foobar") ++
 1240: 	binary_to_list(http_chunk:encode_last()),
 1241:     FooBar =  Foo ++ "\r\n\r\nOther:inets_test\r\n\r\n",
 1242: 
 1243:     UserPasswd = base64:encode_to_string("Alladin:Sesame"),
 1244:     Auth = "Basic " ++ UserPasswd,
 1245: 
 1246:     %% The dummy server will ignore the headers, we only want to test
 1247:     %% that the client header-handling code. This would not
 1248:     %% be a valid http-request!
 1249:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} =
 1250: 	httpc:request(post,
 1251: 		     {URL,
 1252: 		      [{"Via",
 1253: 			"1.0 fred, 1.1 nowhere.com (Apache/1.1)"},
 1254: 		       {"Warning","1#pseudonym foobar"},
 1255: 		       {"Vary","*"},
 1256: 		       {"Upgrade","HTTP/2.0"},
 1257: 		       {"Pragma", "1#no-cache"},
 1258: 		       {"Cache-Control", "no-cache"},
 1259: 		       {"Connection", "close"},
 1260: 		       {"Date", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1261: 		       {"Accept", " text/plain; q=0.5, text/html"},
 1262: 		       {"Accept-Language", "en"},
 1263: 		       {"Accept-Encoding","chunked"},
 1264: 		       {"Accept-Charset", "ISO8859-1"},
 1265: 		       {"Authorization", Auth},
 1266: 		       {"Expect", "1#100-continue"},
 1267: 		       {"User-Agent","inets"},
 1268: 		       {"Transfer-Encoding","chunked"},
 1269: 		       {"Range", " bytes=0-499"},
 1270: 		       {"If-Range", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1271: 		       {"If-Match", "*"},
 1272: 		       {"Content-Type", "text/plain"},
 1273: 		       {"Content-Length", "6"},
 1274: 		       {"Content-Language", "en"},
 1275: 		       {"Content-Location", "http://www.foobar.se"},
 1276: 		       {"Content-MD5",
 1277: 			"104528739076276072743283077410617235478"},
 1278: 		       {"Content-Range", "bytes 0-499/1234"},
 1279: 		       {"Allow", "GET"},
 1280: 		       {"Proxy-Authorization", Auth},
 1281: 		       {"Expires", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1282: 		       {"Upgrade", "HTTP/2.0"},
 1283: 		       {"Last-Modified", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1284: 		       {"Trailer","1#User-Agent"}
 1285: 		      ], "text/plain", FooBar},
 1286: 		     [], []).
 1287: 
 1288:

 1291: headers_with_obs_fold(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1292:     Request = {url(group_name(Config), "/obs_folded_headers.html", Config), []},
 1293:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, Headers, [_|_]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], []),
 1294:     "a b" = proplists:get_value("folded", Headers).
 1295:

 1297: 
 1298: headers_conflict_chunked_with_length(doc) ->
 1299:     ["Test the code for handling headers with both Transfer-Encoding"
 1300:      "and Content-Length which must receive error in default (not relaxed) mode"
 1301:      "and must receive successful response in relaxed mode"];
 1302: headers_conflict_chunked_with_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1303:     Request = {url(group_name(Config), "/headers_conflict_chunked_with_length.html", Config), []},
 1304:     {error, {could_not_parse_as_http, _}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [{relaxed, false}], []),
 1305:     {ok,{{_,200,_},_,_}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [{relaxed, true}], []),
 1306:     ok.
 1307:

 1309: 
 1310: 
 1311: invalid_headers_key(Config) ->
 1312:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1313:                 [{cookie, "valid cookie"}]},
 1314:     {error, {headers_error, invalid_field}} =
 1315:         httpc:request(get, Request, [], []).
 1316: 
 1317: invalid_headers_value(Config) ->
 1318:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1319:                 [{"cookie", atom_value}]},
 1320:     {error, {headers_error, invalid_value}} =
 1321:         httpc:request(get, Request, [], []).
 1322: 
 1323: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1324: 
 1325: %% Doc not generated, but we can live without that.  It should be
 1326: %%  [{doc, "Header type test"}].
 1327: -define(HDR_TYPE_TEST(Name, Method, Value),
 1328:         Name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1329:             test_header_type(Config, Method, Value)).
 1330: 
 1331: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_0, get, "stringheader").
 1332: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_1, get, <<"binary">>).
 1333: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_2, get, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1334: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_3, head, "stringheader").
 1335: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_4, head, <<"binary">>).
 1336: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_5, head, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1337: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_6, post, "stringheader").
 1338: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_7, post, <<"binary">>).
 1339: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_8, post, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1340: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_9, put, "stringheader").
 1341: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_10, put, <<"binary">>).
 1342: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_11, put, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1343: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_12, delete, "stringheader").
 1344: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_13, delete, <<"binary">>).
 1345: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_14, delete, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1346: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_15, trace, "stringheader").
 1347: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_16, trace, <<"binary">>).
 1348: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_17, trace, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1349: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_18, patch, "stringheader").
 1350: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_19, patch, <<"binary">>).
 1351: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_20, patch, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1352: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_21, options, "stringheader").
 1353: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_22, options, <<"binary">>).
 1354: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_23, options, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1355: 
 1356: test_header_type(Config, Method, Value) ->
 1357:     {Method, Value, {ok, _Data}} =
 1358:         {Method, Value,
 1359:          httpc:request(Method,
 1360:                       make_request(Config, Method, Value),
 1361:                       [],
 1362:                       [])}.
 1363: 
 1364: make_request(Config, Method, Value) ->
 1365:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1366:     Headers = [{"other-header", Value},
 1367:                {"user-agent", Value}],
 1368:     %% Generate request with or without body, depending on method.
 1369:     case method_type(Method) of
 1370:         read ->
 1371:             {URL, Headers};
 1372:         write ->
 1373:             {URL, Headers, "text/plain", ""}
 1374:     end.
 1375: 
 1376: method_type(Method) ->
 1377:     case Method of
 1378:         get -> read;
 1379:         head -> read;
 1380:         options -> read;
 1381:         trace -> read;
 1382:         post -> write;
 1383:         put -> write;
 1384:         delete -> write;
 1385:         patch -> write
 1386:     end.
 1387: 
 1388: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1389: 
 1390: invalid_body(Config) ->
 1391:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1392:     {error, invalid_request} =
 1393:         httpc:request(post, {URL, [], <<"text/plain">>, "foobar"},
 1394:                       [], []).
 1395: 
 1396: invalid_body_fun(Config) ->
 1397:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1398:     BodyFun = fun() -> body_part end,
 1399:     {error, {bad_body_generator, _}} =
 1400:         httpc:request(post, {URL, [], "text/plain", {BodyFun, init}},
 1401:                       [], []).
 1402: 
 1403: 
 1404: invalid_method(Config) ->
 1405:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1406:     {error, invalid_method} =
 1407:         httpc:request(past, {URL, [], <<"text/plain">>, "foobar"},
 1408:                       [], []).
 1409: 
 1410: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1411: 
 1412: binary_url(Config) ->
 1413:     URL = uri_string:normalize(url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config)),
 1414:     {ok, _Response} = httpc:request(unicode:characters_to_binary(URL)).
 1415: 
 1416: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1417: 
 1418: iolist_body(Config) ->
 1419:     {ok, ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,once}, binary]),
 1420:     {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(ListenSocket),
 1421: 
 1422:     ProcessHeaders = 
 1423:         fun 
 1424:             F([], Acc) ->
 1425:                 Acc;
 1426:             F([Line|Tail], Acc0) ->
 1427:                 Acc1 = 
 1428:                     case binary:split(Line, <<": ">>, [trim_all]) of
 1429:                         [Key, Value] ->
 1430:                             Acc0#{Key => Value};
 1431:                         _ ->
 1432:                             Acc0
 1433:                     end,
 1434:                 F(Tail, Acc1)
 1435:         end,
 1436:     
 1437:     proc_lib:spawn(fun() ->
 1438:         {ok, Accept} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket),
 1439:         receive
 1440:             {tcp, Accept, Msg} ->
 1441:                 ct:log("Message received: ~p", [Msg]),
 1442:                 [_HeadLine | HeaderLines] = binary:split(Msg, <<"\r\n">>, [global]),
 1443:                 Headers = ProcessHeaders(HeaderLines, #{}),
 1444:                 ContentLength = maps:get(<<"content-length">>, Headers, "-1"),
 1445:                 gen_tcp:send(Accept, [
 1446:                     "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n",
 1447:                     "\r\n",
 1448:                     ContentLength
 1449:                 ])
 1450:         after
 1451:             1000 ->
 1452:                 ct:fail("Timeout: did not receive packet")
 1453:         end
 1454:     end),
 1455: 
 1456:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
 1457:     URL = ?URL_START ++ Host ++ ":" ++ integer_to_list(Port),
 1458:     ReqBody = [
 1459:         <<"abc">>,
 1460:         <<"def">>
 1461:     ],
 1462:     {ok, Resp} = httpc:request(post, {URL, _Headers = [], _ContentType = "text/plain", ReqBody}, [], []),
 1463:     ct:log("Got response ~p", [Resp]),
 1464:     case Resp of
 1465:         {{"HTTP/1.1", 200, "OK"}, [], RespBody} ->
 1466:             ReqBody_ContentLength = list_to_integer([C || C <- RespBody, C =/= $\s]),
 1467:             ?assertEqual(iolist_size(ReqBody), ReqBody_ContentLength);
 1468:         _ ->
 1469:             ct:fail("Didn't receive the correct response")
 1470:     end.
 1471: 
 1472: 
 1473: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1474: 
 1475: no_scheme(_Config) ->
 1476:     {error,{bad_scheme,"ftp"}} = httpc:request("ftp://foobar"),
 1477:     {error,{no_scheme}} = httpc:request("//foobar"),
 1478:     {error,{no_scheme}} = httpc:request("foobar"),
 1479:     ok.
 1480:

 1483: 
 1484: invalid_uri(Config) ->
 1485:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/bar?x[]=a", Config),
 1486:     {error, invalid_uri} = httpc:request(URL),
 1487:     ok.
 1488:
